data.text:
Steve Carell was born August 16, 1962, in Acton, Massachusetts. He is an actor, writer and comedian who first became recognized for his work as a correspondent for The Daily Show with Jon Stewart.

After working as a mail carrier and applying to law school, Carell joined the Second City Improv Group in 1991. After a series of minor roles in film and television and his work on The Daily Show, Carell segued into film roles such as those in Bruce Almighty and Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy.

Gaining popularity, Carell was cast in the lead role of Michael Scott in the American version of The Office, which made him a household name. The role also garnered him a Golden Globe award and an Emmy nomination.

From there he went on to starring in The 40-year-old Virgin, which he co-wrote and developed. The movie was a huge success.

In 2006, he won a SAG award for Best Motion Picture Cast for his role in Little Miss Sunshine alongside Toni Collette, Greg Kinnear and Alan Arkin.

He has been married to Nancy Walls since 1995. The two met while teaching at Second City and have a son and a daughter.
